 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּדָּן‎</span><sub>11</sub> **proper name, of a location** (***? garden, field***; compare [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּדְּנָא‎</span> ***yoke, span of oxen***; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***yoke***, whence, as loan-word Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Frä|Frä]]<sup>129</sup>; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***padanu,***</u></abbr> = ***road***, and also ***garden***, etc. (in word-lists, see KAT3/4, 612); also [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>Aramaic in Ency. Bib</sup>.); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פ‎</span> [[Gen.48.7|Gen 48:7]], abbreviated from <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּדַּןאֲֿרָם‎</span> (? = ***garden, field of*** [***in***] ***Aram***; conjectures by many that <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׂדֵה אֲרָם‎</span> [[Hos.12.13|Hos 12:13]] is Hebrew translation, compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Gen.25.20|Gen 25:20]]</sup>) [[Gen.25.20|Gen 25:20]] + 5 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎פַּדֶּ֫נָה א‎</span> [[Gen.28.2|Gen 28:2]] f. (see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲרָם‎</span> **b**; all [[BDB#P|P]]); [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">Μεσοποταμία</span> (<span class="bdbLangGreek">Συρίας</span>); perhaps ***Paddânâ***, near Haran (and <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***Tel Fedd¹n***</u></abbr> of Arabic geography), see [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>l.c</sup>.
